block.p: Bronwen Forbes Charters, a daughter of Ann and Thomas Charters of Manhattan, was married on Wednesday to William Sullivan Mason, the son of Kathy and Steve Mason of New Rochelle, N.Y. Janet L. Sutherland, a deputy city clerk in Sarasota, Fla., officiated at the Sarasota County Courthouse. Last evening, Peter M. Lauriat, an associate justice of the Superior Court of Massachusetts and a friend of the bride's family, led a marriage celebration at Cà d'Zan, the Ringling mansion and museum in Sarasota.
The bride and bridegroom met at Vanderbilt, where the bride received a law degree and the bridegroom an M.B.A.

Bronwen Forbes Charters, a daughter of Ann and Thomas Charters of Manhattan, was married on Wednesday to William Sullivan Mason, the son of Kathy and Steve Mason of New Rochelle, N.Y. Janet L. Sutherland, a deputy city clerk in Sarasota, Fla., officiated at the Sarasota County Courthouse. Last evening, Peter M. Lauriat, an associate justice of the Superior Court of Massachusetts and a friend of the bride’s family, led a marriage celebration at Cà d’Zan, the Ringling mansion and museum in Sarasota.

Bronwen Forbes Charters, a daughter of Ann and Thomas Charters of Manhattan, was married on Wednesday to William Sullivan Mason, the son of Kathy and Steve Mason of New Rochelle, N.Y. Janet L. Sutherland, a deputy city clerk in Sarasota, Fla., officiated at the Sarasota County Courthouse. Last evening, Peter M. Lauriat, an associate justice of the Superior Court of Massachusetts and a friend of the bride's family, led a marriage celebration at Cà d'Zan, the Ringling mansion and museum in Sarasota.
The bride and bridegroom met at Vanderbilt, where the bride received a law degree and the bridegroom an M.B.A.
Mrs. Mason, 27, is an associate specializing in securities law at Shearman & Sterling, the Manhattan law firm. She graduated from the University of Chicago.

Her father is the president of PCFG Advisory, an investment management firm in Manhattan. Her mother is the chairwoman of Off-the-Record, a lecture series of the Foreign Policy Association, on whose board she serves.
Mr. Mason, 30, is an associate and investment representative in the private wealth management division of Morgan Stanley in Manhattan. He graduated from St. Lawrence University.
His mother is a reading teacher at Public School 56 in the Bronx. His father is a national accounts manager , at Tootsie Roll Industries of Chicago and works in New Rochelle.
